name: py-ax-platform

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Adaptive experimentation is the machine-learning guided process of
iteratively exploring a (possibly infinite) parameter space in order to
identify optimal configurations in a resource-efficient manner. Ax
currently supports Bayesian optimization and bandit optimization as
exploration strategies. Bayesian optimization in Ax is powered by
BoTorch, a modern library for Bayesian optimization research built on
PyTorch.

dependencies.name: py-botorch
dependencies.description: BoTorch is a library for Bayesian Optimization built on PyTorch.

dependencies.name: py-ipywidgets
dependencies.description: IPython widgets for the Jupyter Notebook

dependencies.name: py-jinja2
dependencies.description:
Jinja2 is a template engine written in pure Python. It provides a Django
inspired non-XML syntax but supports inline expressions and an optional
sandboxed environment.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-plotly
dependencies.description: An interactive, browser-based graphing library for Python

dependencies.name: py-scikit-learn
dependencies.description: A set of python modules for machine learning and data mining.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.
